page.title: 10CHANGING TIMES
page.content: The reduction of the labour force required on farms due to mechanisation and the closure of a large boot and shoe factory in Maybole has led to a movement of labour away from the area. This reduction in population has led to the closure of many village shops. A scheme of Council houses has been built with water,electricity,coal fires and indoor sanitation.Almost every home has a television set,some have two.The quality of life is much improved.Mothers are working outwith the home and can afford to purchase labour-saving appliances.Elderly residents,living alone,receive "meals on wheels" from Ayr.The manse has been sold as the minister has joint charge of Crosshill and Dalrymple where he resides.Police house is unoccupied. Head teacher does not live in village. Many residents have cars,some have 2.
